intro: Myrmephytum arfakianum, commonly known as the Arfak mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of New Guinea. It is a member of the Montiaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features small, blue or violet flowers that bloom in the summer months. Its leaves are succulent and adapted to the arid conditions of its native habitat. Myrmephytum arfakianum is often found in rocky or sandy soils at elevations above 1,500 meters.
